problem_text:
An undirected graph is called a locally finite Cayley graph of a group G if its vertex set can be identified with the set of elements of G in such a way that, for some finite generating set X = X−1 of G not containing 1, two vertices g and h are adjacent if and only if g−1h ∈ X. Do there exist two finitely generated groups with the same locally finite Cayley graph, one of which is periodic and the other is not periodic?
V. I. Trofimov
